In the availability of defaults case, you will be broken until you set the variable. This is usually undesirable for upstream projects, but in your case you specifically are looking for being broken when there is a change in configure?

Nevertheless, I still do not see a benefit that outweighs the added complexity in configuration script.
Also, our future plans involve deprecating configure script, and routing everything through --config flags in bazel. So I am inclined to reject this PR.

body:
In the availability of defaults case, you will be broken until you set the variable. This is usually undesirable for upstream projects, but in your case you specifically are looking for being broken when there is a change in configure?

Nevertheless, I still do not see a benefit that outweighs the added complexity in configuration script.
Also, our future plans involve deprecating configure script, and routing everything through `--config` flags in bazel. So I am inclined to reject this PR.
